snippet.textDisplay:
Look, I know this might ruffle some chainmail, but Khazan and Nioh are the only Souls-likes I actually vibe with. Why? Because they give me what I crave—armor with perks, set bonuses, and actual gameplay impact. You know, the stuff that makes you feel like you're building a god-slaying war machine, not just modeling for the cover of Medieval Drip Monthly.

Meanwhile, Dark Souls and Elden Ring? Yeah, they look cool, I guess. But let’s be honest—gear in those games is like a fancy bathrobe: lots of style, but zero spice. It’s all “ooh look at my poise and fire resist,” and I’m over here begging for literally any passive bonus that makes me feel clever for wearing it.

Give me that sweet dopamine from set effects, give me builds that feel like builds—not “here’s a sword, go suffer.”

TL;DR:
If I’m gonna die 342 times, I want to do it while wearing armor that actually does something besides just existing. Sorry FromSoft, but my loyalty lies with the perk bros: Khazan and Nioh.

snippet.textDisplay: So many Sekirolikes and Niohlikes, but I still haven’t heard of a true Soulslike that is not a Fromsoft game. I wish some devs would copy more of Fromsoft’s level design and flexible combat and less of the punishing parry based gameplay of these games. Lies of P and now this are too difficult for me because they rely too much on parrying, which is not what I like in souls games. I hate parrying and rhythm based games. Sekiro was the best that I tried but I couldn’t finish it.

snippet.textDisplay: Could someone define “souls-like?” This doesn’t look like a souls-like. I loved Stellar Blade so this being compared to that sounds right up my alley. Fast and frenetic action combat like Stellar Blade and Devil May Cry are my type of games and have been playing them forever. I wouldn’t call them a souls-like. I’ve played souls games and the combat just isn’t my cup of tea and so different than the games with the style of combat I enjoy. So I get the impression that the term “souls-like” gets thrown around way too much these days.
snippet.textOriginal: Could someone define “souls-like?” This doesn’t look like a souls-like. I loved Stellar Blade so this being compared to that sounds right up my alley. snippet.textDisplay:
Sounds promising... However, one of the biggest parts of the Souls games is the exploration. Always looking for that next item, special enemy, a reason to search through every nook and cranny and being rewarded for it. Maybe a useless item, maybe my next go to, or maybe some hidden side boss or a whole new secret side area. That makes me want to explore the world and where i put a lot of my time in initial playthroughs. 

Builds give them replayability and help keep them fresh for a while of course.

Both of things seem to be somewhat lacking, yes i saw hidden walls and such, but im curious how the worlds are. He said only the last 2 or so are Demon Souls at its best. I found Code Vein level design weak in that regard and got bored, as well as being able to switch without respec (no builds per se) turned me off of a second playthrough. I didnt even finish Code Vein, but got close. Nioh was much more streamlined, but i really enjoyed the system with their levels amd twilight levels. Im partial to Nioh because i absolutely loved the combat in those games, and the variety in "builds". 

I guess im just worried this game is more like Code Vein than anything else, which would be a waste of my money.

snippet.textDisplay: I just want to know is the weapon system like nioh 2, or is it like dark souls ? I hate that system that gives you like hundreds of weapons per hour and only garbage that is almost never better then 1 weapon you found hours ago. I never play a game like that ever again because I don't waste my time collecting garbage and sorting them in different categories. I never play that recycling simulation games ever again, nioh2 destroyed that kind of soulslike games for me forever.
